SENT.plain: CAPS is an uncommon disease, characterized by clinical evidence of multiple organ involvement and histopathological evidence of multiple vessel occlusions, in patients with either primary or secondary antiphospholipid syndrome
The present series describes the clinical manifestations and autopsy findings of 12 patients with CAPS
Neurological involvement was considered the main cause of death in all of them
CNS pathology revealed thrombotic microangiopathy as well as small and large vessel occlusions in several brain areas
Neurological involvement in CAPS is strongly associated with thrombotic microangiopathy and should be considered a potential cause of death in these patients
